example[0]: Pull the meat apart with two forks.
definition[1]: to make the relationships between people in a group bad or difficult
example[1]: His drinking pulled the family apart.
definition[2]: to carefully examine or criticize something
example[2]: The selection committee pulled each proposal apart.
definition[3]: to separate people or animals when they are fighting
example[3]: The fight ended only when the referee pulled the two players apart.
definition[4]: if something pulls apart, it breaks into pieces when you pull on it
